alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 08 at 5:33AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Taiya River near Areas Along Low Lying Portions Of The Chilkoot Trail. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 528 AM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing, especially near the Taiya River. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - For Taiya River near Skagway: At 5:00am the stage was 17.13 feet. Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: The river crested at 17.51 feet and river levels are now falling. Will fall below flood levels late Sunday morning. Impacts: At 16.0 feet: Portions of the Chilkoot Trail begins to inundate with water. At 16.5 feet: Portions of the first few miles of the Chilkoot Trail will begin to inundate with water to ankle depth.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
